Hello Steven,

Thank you for the logs. It does look like everything I need for the escalation, so I'm working on that now. In the meantime, you should be good to run a repair on that host. I suspect it will resolve the issue. Even if it does work after the repair, we still want to escalate so Dev can look for a root cause.

To run the repair, please follow the instructions below.
 
Repair the SQL Database


	
	Navigate to and select the 2-FSAA Bulk Import BE job in the NEA Job tree.

	
		
		The exact location in the Job tree can vary based on your deployment.
		
		
		The default location is NEA > Jobs > FileSystem > 0.Collection > 2-FSAA Bulk Import.
		
	
	
	
	Click Configure > Query > Query properties > Configure.

	
		
		This opens the File System Access Audit Data Collector Wizard.
		
	
	
	
	At the bottom of the wizard, click Maintenance.
	
	
	Select the Maintenance type: Repair, then click Next.
	
	
	Select the hosts that are throwing the error (I believe just DRF-ERNIE2 in this instance).
	
	
	Click Run.

	
		
		The maintenance should run immediately.
		
	
	
	
	After the maintenance finishes, click through the following dialogs: Continue > Finish > Next.
	
	Ensure that Import incomplete scan data is enabled, then click Finish.



You should then be able to run the collection and import again.

Please let me know if the error persists, and we will reach out when we have next steps regarding the escalation.
Thank you,

Joshua Sexton
Technical Support Engineer Tier 1
